com.epoch.db

Class DataConversion

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.epoch.db.DBCommon
      • com.epoch.db.DataConversion
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AssgtConstants, FormatConstants, EnergyQDatumConstants, EvalImplConstants, ClickConstants, CaptionsQDatumConstants, QDatumConstants, QuestionConstants, XMLConstants

    public final class DataConversion
extends DBCommon
implements AssgtConstants, CaptionsQDatumConstants, ClickConstants, EnergyQDatumConstants, EvalImplConstants, QuestionConstants
    Contains one-time data conversion methods.

      • debugPrint

        private static void debugPrint(Object... msg)

      • getForeignKeys

        public static List<String[]> getForeignKeys(Connection con)
                                     throws DBException
        Gets the foreign keys referencing users_v4.user_id so that we can add ON UPDATE CASCADE to them.
        Parameters:
        con - database connection
        Returns:
        a list of 3-membered arrays consisting of the key name and the dependent table and column
        Throws:
        DBException - when reading the database goes wrong

      • dropForeignKeys

        public static void dropForeignKeys(Connection con,
                                   List<String[]> foreignKeys)
                            throws DBException
        Drops the foreign keys referencing users_v4.user_id so that we can retore them with ON UPDATE CASCADE. 
         alter table cw_course_enrollment_v3
 drop constraint F_ENROLL3_STUDENT
        Parameters:
        con - database connection
        foreignKeys - a list of 3-membered arrays containing key, table, and column names
        Throws:
        DBException - when writing the database goes wrong

      • restoreForeignKeys

        public static void restoreForeignKeys(Connection con,
                                      List<String[]> foreignKeys)
                               throws DBException
        Restores the foreign keys referencing users_v4.user_id so that we can add ON UPDATE CASCADE. 
         alter table cw_course_enrollment_v3
 add constraint F_ENROLL3_STUDENT
 foreign key (student_id) references users_v4(user_id)
 on update cascade;
        Parameters:
        con - database connection
        foreignKeys - a list of 3-membered arrays containing key, table, and column names
        Throws:
        DBException - when writing the database goes wrong

      • dropAndRename

        private static void dropAndRename(String table,
                                  String field)
                           throws DBException
        Drops the BLOB column and renames the CLOB column to the name of the original BLOB column. If this method is combined with writeBLOBsAsCLOBs(), we get an Oracle error, so keep it separate.
        Parameters:
        table - the table
        field - field of the table needed for the query
        Throws:
        DBException - if there's a problem writing to the database

      • updateCodedData

        public static void updateCodedData()
                            throws DBException
        Updates evaluators' coded data in archaic formats to make it uniform, removes _Y from match codes of certain evaluators; also updates the coded data of evaluators stored in question data of synthesis questions.
        Atoms: add flag for contiguity of counted atoms
        Contains: add flag for exact, default, or ignoring of charges, radicals, and isotopes; exact for substructures, ignore for skeletons
        FnalGroup: convert isPos/groupId to groupId/=<>number/number (also in synthesis question data beginning with 14/)
        Formula: convert isPos/formula to =<>/number/countEach/formula (also in synthesis question data beginning with 15/)
        MapProperty: change 1|2 and true|false to Y|N, add patternOnly flags
        MechRule: convert from 3 to 4 data by appending integer of last (float) flag
        MechFlowsValid: convert leniency flag from Y|N to integer so can handle both resonance and double bond stereochemistry
        MechCounter: convert =<> number to symbol, add decrement
        MechProdStartIs: convert leniency flag from Y|N to integer so can handle both resonance and double bond stereochemistry
        MechSubstructure: change true|false to Y|N, add flag to ignore or consider charge, radicals, isotopes
        MultipleCheck: convert old 8-member operator to isPos and 4-member operator
        MultipleNumChosen: convert true|false to Y|N, convert old (nonstandard) numerical =<> operators to symbols
        NumMols: add flags for whether to count distinct molecules and what to consider when deciding whether they are distinct
        Rings: convert ringsOper/numRings to countEach/ringsOper/numRings/molsOper/numMols (also in synthesis question data beginning with 1/)
        SynthOneRxn: add flag to look for whole cpds or substructures
        SynthSteps: convert numerical =<> operators to symbols, add decrement
        Weight: convert numerical =<> operators to symbols, convert last flag from number to word
        Throws:
        DBException - if there's a problem writing to the database
        See Also:
        Atoms, Contains, FnalGroup, HasFormula, MapProperty, NumMols, Rings, MechRule, MechFlowsValid, MechCounter, MechProdStartIs, MechSubstructure, SynthOneRxn, SynthSteps, Weight, MultipleCheck, MultipleNumChosen

      • convertSynthesisFormat

        public static void convertSynthesisFormat()
                                   throws DBException
        Converts syntheses from old format (reaction ID numbers appended to MRV) to new format (reaction ID numbers stored as a molecule property).
        Throws:
        DBException - if there's a problem writing to the database

        private static String extractImage(Connection con,
                                   boolean isLocal,
                                   int imageId,
                                   String filepath)
                            throws SQLException
        Gets the image from the database, writes it to a file.
        Parameters:
        con - database connection
        isLocal - true when should use local tables
        imageId - unique ID of this image
        filepath - file to contain the image, minus the extension
        Returns:
        extension of the image
        Throws:
        SQLException - if there's a problem reading the database

      • splitCaptions

        public static void splitCaptions()
                          throws DBException
        Splits into individual fields:
        • for complete-the-table questions, |-separated strings representing row and column captions
        • for orbital energy diagram questions, tab-separated strings representing 3 column captions and pulldown menu labels
        • for reaction coordinate diagram questions, tab-separated strings representing pulldown menu labels
        • for orbital energy and reaction coordinate diagram questions, tab-separated strings representing y-axis scale information
        numbering the individual fields in the order in which they appear in the strings.

        Serial numbers of each entry need to be set to -1 or -2 before this method is run. For tables, rows and column captions should start in two separate entries with the type field set to R or C; for each energy diagram question, there is one entry with the type field set to C, and maybe another entry with type field set to Y.

        Throws:
        DBException - if there's a problem writing to the database

      • lobToString

        private static String lobToString(ResultSet rs,
                                  String field)
        Reads a BLOB or CLOB from the result of a database call into a String.
        Parameters:
        rs - result of a database call
        field - which field of the result set contains the BLOB or CLOB
        Returns:
        string containing the value of the BLOB or CLOB

      • stringIntoBlob

        private static void stringIntoBlob(Connection con,
                                   String query,
                                   String dataIn)
                            throws SQLException,
                                   IOException
        Stores a string in the database as a BLOB. Note: The database field must be readied before this method is called by setting it to EMPTY_BLOB(), because a shorter string will not overwrite a longer string.
        Parameters:
        con - database connection
        query - retrieves the BLOB field
        dataIn - data to store in the BLOB
        Throws:
        SQLException - if there are no results from the query
        IOException - if there are problems opening the BLOB

      • replace

        private static String replace(String field,
                              String srchStr,
                              String replaceStr)
        Subjects three strings to replace().
        Parameters:
        field - field containing the values to be searched
        srchStr - string for which to search
        replaceStr - replacement string
        Returns:
        the three strings enclosed in replace(), the latter two in quotes

      • slash

        private static String slash(int num)
        Surrounds a number with slash marks.
        Parameters:
        num - a number
        Returns:
        the number surrounded by slash marks

        Surrounds a string with slash marks.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the string surrounded by slash marks

      • ascii

        private static StringBuilder ascii(StringBuilder bld)
        Subjects a string to ASCII().
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the string surrounded by ASCII() in a StringBuilder
